item.title: 波哥大最昂贵的新公寓打破了哥伦比亚住房市场的不景气局面
item.description:
在这个新建筑基本处于停滞状态的城市，一座豪华建筑群正从原来的零散房产中崛起。【原文：

A luxury complex is rising out of a former patchwork of properties in a city where new construction is largely stalled.

】

item.title: 美联储会议前美元将创一个月来最大单周跌幅
item.description: 在美联储会议召开之前，美元有望创下一个多月以来的最大单周跌幅。【原文：The dollar is on track for its sharpest weekly drop in more than a month ahead of a Federal Reserve meeting that’s expected to launch a series of interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 受特朗普政策打击的太阳能制造商准备反击
item.description:
清洁能源这一重量级产业正在想方设法夺回其作为增长最快、最廉价电力来源的头衔。【原文：

Clean energy’s heavyweight industry is figuring out how to reclaim its title as the fastest-growing, cheapest source of power.

】

item.title: 干燥天气威胁下季收成，可可将迎来每周涨幅
item.description: 由于西非的干旱天气威胁到下一季可可的生产，使本已紧张的全球供应更加紧张，可可期货每周都在上涨。【原文：Cocoa futures headed for a weekly advance as dry weather in West Africa threatens next season’s production, straining already tight global supplies.】

item.title: 科技初创企业 Urban 是 2025 年印度认购最多的 IPO
item.description: 科技初创公司 Urban Company Ltd. 的首次公开发行募集了 2.16 亿美元，吸引了超过发行量 100 倍的投标，成为印度今年募集 1 亿美元或以上的股票销售中认购最多的一次。【原文：Tech startup Urban Company Ltd.’s $216 million initial public offering drew bids for more than 100 times the shares offered, making it the most subscribed share sales in India this year among those that raised $100 million or more.】

item.title: 非洲国家向国际货币基金组织（IMF）申请 690 亿美元贷款，向贷款方的倾斜将持续下去
item.description: 非洲国家对国际货币基金组织融资的需求预计仍将居高不下，因为债务负担不断加重，而更便宜的选择仍然稀缺，即使人们对其苛刻的紧缩条件的反弹不断增加。【原文：Demand from African nations for financing from the International Monetary Fund is expected to remain high, as debt burdens mount and cheaper options remain scarce, even as backlash grows over its austerity-heavy terms.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将降息指挥棒交给美联储
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济学编辑，今天我们将探讨欧洲央行如何将降息接力棒传给美联储。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at how the ECB is passing the rate-cutting baton to the Fed. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 中国安踏 "千店计划 "推动东南亚市场增长
item.description: 2025 年上半年，安踏体育用品有限公司在东南亚的零售额几乎翻了一番，该公司将加大在东南亚的扩张力度，计划在三年内销售其同名品牌的门店数量达到 1000 家。【原文：Anta Sports Products Ltd. will intensify expansion in Southeast Asia with plans to reach a 1,000 stores in three years selling its namesake brand after retail sales in the region nearly doubled for the first half of 2025.】

item.title: 我们希望人工智能记住我们多少信息？
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃伦-休特（Ellen Huet）将探讨流行的人工智能聊天机器人在记忆保持方面的快速进步。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet looks at the rapid improvement in memory retention by the popular AI chatbots.】

item.title: 中国新朋因转向故障召回约 70% 的 P7+ 电动汽车
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商新鹏公司正在召回47,490辆P7+轿车，此举将影响至少70%的已购客户，原因是转向问题存在安全隐患。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng Inc. is recalling 47,490 of its P7+ sedans, a move that will impact at least 70% of the customers who have purchased one, due to a steering issue that poses safety risks.】

item.title: 俄罗斯将关键利率降至 17%，无视加快宽松政策的呼声
item.description: 尽管由于经济降温速度快于预期，且今年的经济增长有可能低于官方目标，人们呼吁俄罗斯央行采取更积极的货币宽松政策，但俄罗斯央行选择的降息幅度小于预期。【原文：The Bank of Russia opted for a smaller interest-rate cut than expected, despite calls for more aggressive monetary easing as the economy cools faster than forecast and growth risks undershooting official targets this year.】

item.title: 印度通胀率 10 个月来首次上升
item.description: 印度的通货膨胀率在 8 月份出现了 10 个月以来的首次加速，尽管其幅度较低，但足以让印度央行在经济增长受到冲击时保持降息的大门敞开。【原文：India’s inflation accelerated for the first time in 10 months in August, though low enough for the central bank to keep the door open for interest rate cuts if economic growth takes a knock.】

item.title: 股票和债券价格都在说美联储迄今为止是正确的
item.description:
美国银行的哈特内特说，美联储 "可以可信地进行削减"。【原文：

The Fed ‘can cut with credibility,’ Bank of America’s Hartnett says.  

】

item.title: 经济学家认为美联储下周降息，2025 年至少再降息一次
item.description: 据彭博新闻社调查的经济学家称，就业市场的裂痕很可能会促使美联储在未来几个月内实施一系列降息措施，从下周的降息开始。【原文：Cracks in the job market will likely prompt the Federal Reserve to execute a series of interest-rate cuts in the coming months, beginning with a reduction next week, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: Amundi 预计欧洲央行将再减息两次，即使交易员打赌欧洲央行已经减息完毕
item.description: Amundi SA 首席投资官表示，由于经济增长可能依然乏力，欧洲央行将再降息两次。【原文：The European Central Bank will cut interest rates two more times as economic growth is likely to remain lackluster, according to Amundi SA’s chief investment officer.】

item.title: 投资者质疑销量和估值飙升，特斯拉转向机器人领域
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）可能正试图将特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Elon Musk may be trying to pivot Tesla Inc. away from electric vehicles and toward humanoid robots, but to skeptical investors there’s no hiding from its stagnating sales and eye-watering stock market valuation that leaves little room for error.】

item.title: 瑞士政府考虑收费资助反洗钱机构
item.description: 瑞士政府正在考虑收取费用，为洗钱报告办公室提供资金，以应对近年来可疑活动报告数量急剧上升的情况。【原文：The Swiss government is considering the introduction of fees to fund the Money Laundering Reporting Office, reacting to a sharply rising number of reports of suspicious activity in recent years.】

item.title: 交易员锁定美联储押注，连续四周推升国债
item.description: 在周四的失业救济数据巩固了美联储下周将降息的预期后，国债将把涨势延续到第四周。【原文：Treasuries were set to extend their rally into a fourth week after Thursday’s jobless claims data cemented expectations the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next week.】

item.title: 华尔街预计风险最高股票的反弹将持续 12 个月
item.description: 罗素 2000 指数（Russell 2000）是市场上一些风险最高的股票的所在地，该指数一路高歌猛进，华尔街的许多策略师都说，这轮涨势才刚刚开始。【原文：The Russell 2000, home to some of the riskiest stocks on the market, has been on a tear — and a spate of Wall Street strategists say the rally is just getting started.】

item.title: 瑞士法律草案允许私营部门帮助乌克兰重建
item.description: 瑞士政府希望允许更多私营公司参与乌克兰的重建工作。【原文：The Swiss government wants to allow more private companies to get involved in the reconstruction of Ukraine.】

item.title: 纳格尔说：欧盟银行监管机构必须大胆简化规则
item.description: 一位致力于简化规则框架的高级官员表示，欧洲当局应拿出勇气，努力减轻银行的监管负担，同时又不削弱银行的抗风险能力。【原文：European authorities should show courage in their efforts to reduce the regulatory burden on banks without undermining their resilience, according to a top official working on simplifying the rules framework.】

item.title: 印度计划在中国边境附近修建价值 34 亿美元的铁路线
item.description: 印度将通过增加铁路基础设施来加强其东北边境，以深化交通、加快物流并确保军事准备，以防与邻国中国的热络关系再次出现问题。【原文：India is set to reinforce its northeastern frontier by adding railway infrastructure to deepen access, accelerate logistics and ensure military readiness in case warming ties with neighboring China falter again.】

item.title: 需求疲软，债券销售放缓，中国信贷扩张放缓
item.description: 由于融资需求持续疲软，而政府为基础设施投资等支出提供的借贷减少，8 月份中国的信贷增长速度较一年前有所放缓，贷款扩张速度低于预期。【原文：China’s credit growth slowed from a year ago in August with its loan expansion falling short of forecasts, as demand for financing stayed soft while the government borrowed less to fund spending such as infrastructure investment.】

item.title: 土耳其投资者在法院对反对党作出裁决前惶惶不安
item.description: 土耳其股市有望创下 2 月份以来最长的单周连跌记录，投资者在该国主要反对党领导权的另一场法庭争夺战前惶惶不可终日。【原文：Turkish stocks are on track for their longest weekly losing streak since February, with investors on edge ahead of yet another court battle over the leadership of the country’s main opposition party.】

item.title: 中国需求无回升迹象，天然气市场为供应过剩做好准备
item.description: 在米兰举行的一次重要行业会议上，全球天然气贸易商对中国买家的需求何时甚至是否会反弹尚未达成明确共识。【原文：Global gas traders are leaving a major industry conference in Milan without a clear consensus on when — or even if — demand from Chinese buyers will rebound, a key risk as liquefied natural gas supplies keep piling up.】

item.title: 英国通胀预期创两年新高令英国央行头疼不已
item.description: 英国家庭的通胀预期达到了两年来的最高水平，这使英格兰银行在控制物价压力的斗争中遭遇挫折。【原文：UK households’ inflation expectations hit the highest level in two years, a setback for the Bank of England in its battle to keep price pressures under control.】

item.title: 花旗称日本 5500 亿美元美国基金或将推动小型外汇协议的达成
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）分析师称，作为日本与美国关税协议一部分的 5,500 亿美元投资基金可能会大量动用这个亚洲国家 1.3 万亿美元的货币储备。【原文：The $550 billion investment fund that formed part of Japan’s tariff deal with the US may draw heavily on the Asian nation’s $1.3 trillion currency reserves, according to analysts at Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 特朗普抨击的数字税得到法国法院支持
item.description: 受到硅谷和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评的法国数字服务税赢得了国家宪法法官的支持。【原文：France’s tax on digital services, criticized by Silicon Valley and US President Donald Trump, won the backing of the nation’s constitutional judges.】

item.title: 美国银行称投资者支持美联储在降息时机上的可信度
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）表示，金融市场押注美联储在开始降低借贷成本时仍将 "领先曲线"。【原文：Financial markets are betting the Federal Reserve will still be “ahead of the curve” when it starts lowering borrowing costs, according to Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: 罗布-卡普兰谈美联储、人工智能以及全球化如何在没有美国的情况下发生
item.description:
为什么前达拉斯联储主席认为降息50个基点不太可能？【原文：

Why the former Dallas Fed president sees a 50 bps cut as unlikely.

】
